clauses.title: Definitions
clauses.text: In this Schedule:

children.title: UK GDPR Terms
children.text: "Controller", "Processor", "Personal Data", "Processing", "Personal Data Breach", "Data Subject", and "Supervisory Authority" have the meanings given in the UK GDPR.

children.title: Services
children.text: "Services" has the meaning set out in the Terms.

children.title: Sub-processor
children.text: "Sub-processor" means any third party engaged by {{company.shortName}} to process Personal Data on behalf of the Client.

clauses.title: Acknowledgement of Roles
clauses.text: For the purposes of the UK GDPR, the Client is the Controller of Personal Data processed in connection with the Services and {{company.shortName}} is the Processor, unless otherwise agreed in writing.

clauses.title: Processing on Instructions
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall process Personal Data only on documented instructions from the Client, including as set out in the Terms and this Schedule, unless required to do otherwise by applicable law.

clauses.title: AI Acknowledgement
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that {{company.shortName}} does not control the content of AI model outputs and processes Personal Data solely to provide the Services as configured and instructed by the Client.

clauses.title: Subject Matter
clauses.text: Provision of chatbot configuration, integration and related services.

clauses.title: Duration
clauses.text: For the duration of the Services and any applicable retention period agreed in writing or required by law.

clauses.title: Nature and Purpose
clauses.text: Processing Personal Data as necessary to configure, operate and support chatbot interactions and integrations as instructed by the Client.

clauses.title: Categories of Data Subjects
clauses.text: May include the Client’s customers, prospective customers, employees, contractors and other end users who interact with the chatbot.

clauses.title: Types of Personal Data
clauses.text: May include names, contact details, message content, identifiers and any other Personal Data submitted by or on behalf of the Client through use of the Services.

clauses.title: {{company.shortName}}’s Obligations
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall:

children.title: Process on Instructions
children.text: process Personal Data only in accordance with the Client’s documented instructions;

children.title: Confidentiality
children.text: ensure persons authorised to process Personal Data are subject to confidentiality obligations;

children.title: Security
children.text: implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect Personal Data;

children.title: Personnel Reliability
children.text: take reasonable steps to ensure the reliability of personnel with access to Personal Data.

clauses.title: Client Responsibility for Lawfulness
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} does not determine the purposes of processing and relies on the Client to ensure its instructions comply with applicable data protection laws.

clauses.title: General Authorisation
clauses.text: The Client authorises {{company.shortName}} to engage Sub-processors for provision of the Services, including hosting, infrastructure, AI and messaging providers.

clauses.title: Sub-processor Obligations
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall ensure Sub-processors are subject to data protection obligations substantially similar to those in this Schedule.

clauses.title: Sub-processor List
clauses.text: A current list of Sub-processors may be provided via the client portal or upon reasonable request.

clauses.title: Changes to Sub-processors
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} may add or replace Sub-processors from time to time and will provide prior notice of material changes where reasonably practicable. The Client may object on reasonable data protection grounds within 14 days, and the parties will discuss a resolution in good faith.

clauses.title: Transfers
clauses.text: Personal Data may be transferred or processed outside the UK in connection with the Services.

clauses.title: Safeguards
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall ensure appropriate safeguards such as the UK International Data Transfer Agreement or other approved mechanisms are in place.

clauses.title: Security
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall implement technical and organisational measures designed to provide security appropriate to risk.

clauses.title: No Absolute Security
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that no system is completely secure.

clauses.title: Notification
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall notify the Client without undue delay after becoming aware of a Personal Data Breach affecting Personal Data processed on the Client’s behalf.

clauses.title: Assistance
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} shall provide reasonable assistance to enable the Client to comply with UK GDPR breach notification obligations.

clauses.title: Scope
clauses.text: Taking into account the nature of processing, {{company.shortName}} shall provide reasonable assistance with data subject requests, regulatory inquiries, data protection impact assessments (DPIAs), and consultations with the UK Information Commissioner’s Office where required.

clauses.title: Fees
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} may charge reasonable fees for assistance requiring material effort or outside the scope of the Services.

clauses.title: Deletion or Return
clauses.text: On termination, {{company.shortName}} shall delete or return Personal Data at the Client’s option, subject to applicable law.

clauses.title: Exceptions
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} may retain Personal Data where required by law or for legitimate purposes such as backups or dispute resolution, and such data will remain protected and deleted in accordance with {{company.shortName}}’s standard retention policies.

clauses.title: Audit Right
clauses.text: The Client may audit {{company.shortName}}’s compliance once per 12 months on reasonable notice.

clauses.title: Conditions
clauses.text: Audits must be reasonable in scope, during business hours, subject to confidentiality, and limited to information necessary to demonstrate compliance.

clauses.title: Alternative Evidence
clauses.text: {{company.shortName}} may satisfy audit requests by providing certifications or third-party audit reports where available.

clauses.title: Audit Costs
clauses.text: The Client bears its own audit costs and shall reimburse {{company.shortName}} for reasonable time spent supporting any audit.

clauses.title: Liability Alignment
clauses.text: Liability arising under this Schedule is subject to the limitations and exclusions set out in the Terms.
